6. $50 million in subsidies for tree planting on private properties #ShadySandySpending

1. $2 million for damage to DC museum roofs, while many in Hurricane Sandy's path still have no roof over their heads #ShadySandySpending

#1 - Creates new USDA office to inspect catfish. FDA already inspects catfish, so this one’s a real bottom-feeder. #FarmBillPork
#2 - $200 mil Market Access Program promoting brands overseas. Example: Holding "liquor mixology demonstrations" in Russia. #FarmBillPork
#3 - $25 million to study health benefits of peas, lentils and garbanzo beans. Pretty sure they’re healthy. #FarmBillPork
#4 - Subsidies for mohair (AKA goat wool), which have cost taxpayers $20 million+ since 1954 #FarmBillPork
#5 - New subsidy for popcorn producers. Yes, popcorn subsidies - after popcorn prices rose 40% in recent yrs. #FarmBillPork
#6 - $10 million to establish new USDA program to eradicate feral pigs. Talk about pork! #FarmBillPork
#7 - $15 million to establish a new grant program to “improve” the U.S. sheep industry. A ba-a-a-a-a-a-d idea. #FarmBillPork
#8 - $700 million for “Ag and Food Research Initiative” funding grants to research pine trees in FL & study moth pheromones #FarmBillPork
#9 - $40 million in grants from USDA to states to encourage private land owners to use land for bird watching or hunting #FarmBillPork
#10 - $200 million for “Value Added Grant Program” often used to give grants to wine producers (& cheese makers too) #FarmBillPork
Drum roll please… In next hour, I’ll tweet countdown of Top 10 pork projects in Senate's #FarmBill. It’s gonna be ugly! #FarmBillPork
